#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Seychelles
#Text=The Seychelles are a group of 115 islands in the Indian
#Text=Ocean that lie off the coast of East Africa , northeast of Madagascar .
#Text=Only a few are inhabited .
#Text=Regions
#Text=Outer Seychelles
#Text=The Outer Seychelles are corralline and mostly uninhabited .
#Text=Visitors are rare , and will find themselves traveling either by private yacht or between remote airstrips on small local planes .
#Text=Inner Seychelles
#Text=The vast majority of the Seychelles ' population lives on these granite islands , home to the bulk of the country 's resorts .
#Text=Cities
#Text=- The Capital City
#Text=- district in Seychelles
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Seychelles is the smallest African country by size and population .
#Text=History
#Text=Maldivian and Arab traders were the first to visit the uninhabited Seychelles .
#Text=The first European to arrive at the islands was Portuguese Admiral Vasco da Gama who passed through the Amirantes in 1502 and named them after himself ( Islands of the Admiral ) .
#Text=They became a waypoint on the Cape Route .
#Text=The Seychelles were disputed between France and Great Britain during the age of colonialism , with Britain ending up in control in 1814 after the Napoleonic Wars .
#Text=The islands achieved independence in 1976 ; however , free elections did not occur until 1993 .
#Text=The politics of this island group remain in something of a state of flux , although this should not bother the tourist seeking a relaxing beach vacation .
#Text=Climate
#Text=Seychelles is hot and humid , with an average yearly temperature of 84°F ( 29°C ) , and average sea temperature rarely dropping below 81°F ( 27°C ) .
#Text=However , the heat is usually mitigated by refreshing sea breezes , especially by the beaches .
#Text=The cooler season in Seychelles is during the southeast monsoon season ( May to September ) and the warmer season is during the northwest monsoon ( November to March ) .
#Text=April and October are " changeover months " between the two monsoons , when the wind is variable .
#Text=The northwest monsoon season tends to be warmer with more rain , while the southeast monsoon season is usually drier and cooler .
#Text=Get in
#Text=No visa is required for any nationality , though all foreigners must have a passport that is valid for at least 6 months , and must have proof of accommodation bookings before arrival .
#Text=An initial entry permit is granted for 1 month but can be extended for a maximum of 3 months at a time up to a maximum of 1 year in total .
#Text=See the official travel web-site .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Seychelles International Airport ( SEZ ) .
#Text=The only international gateway to the Seychelles near the national capital , Victoria .

#Text=Air Seychelles is the country 's flag carrier and flies to Cape Town , Abu Dhabi , Mumbai , Hong Kong , Paris , as well as Dar Es Salaam , Johannesburg , Mauritius and Antananarivo in Madagascar .

#Text=International service is also available from Addis Ababa ( Ethiopian Airlines ) , Nairobi ( Kenya Airways ) , Dubai ( Emirates ) , Abu Dhabi ( Etihad ) , Istanbul ( Turkish Airlines ) , Doha ( Qatar Airways ) , and regular charter services from Frankfurt ( Condor ) and Amsterdam ( Martinair ) .
#Text=By boat
#Text=The strict controls imposed on cruising yachts in the early 1990s have been gradually lifted and rules and regulations are no longer so complicated .
#Text=However , some restrictions remain in force , mostly for the sake of environmental protection as most of the islands are surrounded by coral reefs near the surface .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Air Seychelles operates multiple daily flights between Mahe and Praslin .
#Text=Over two dozen flights vary in frequency from 15-minute to 2-hour intervals , depending on time of day .
#Text=Air Seychelles also operates once daily or several times per week between Mahe and the islands of Bird , Denis , Fregate , Desroches and Alphonse .
#Text=Assumption Island and Coetivy can be reached by air charter .
#Text=By helicopter
#Text=Zil Air provides charter helicopter flights to/from most of the inner and outer Seychelles Islands .
#Text=It is the only scenic flight operator in the Seychelles .

#Text=Scenic flights can be booked to cover the main islands of Mahé , Praslin , La Digue and the surrounding smaller islands of ( among others ) Cousine , Félicité , Grande Seour , Curieuse and Bird Island .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Cat Cocos operates catamaran ferries that provide several daily crossings between Mahe and Praslin and a daily crossing extension to La Digue .
#Text=The sailing normally takes one hour .
#Text=Non-residents should budget between € 90 and € 100 per person ( price at July 2013 , based on a single adult fare of 835 rupees one way ) for a same day return ticket from Mahe to Praslin .
#Text=Tickets can be purchased from the Cat Cocos office , opposite the pier , on the same day before travel subject to availability .
#Text=Similarly , Inter Island Ferry operate a route between Praslin and La Digue with 8 daily departures taking 15 min to cross .
#Text=Tickets cost around € 15 for an adult single ( July 2013 ) .
#Text=The schedule usually allows for onward connections to Mahe with Cat Cocos at Praslin harbour .

#Text=Belle Serafina , a small schooner ferry makes the passage between Mahe and Praslin or La Digue in 3-4 hours , usually departing weekdays shortly around 12 from Mahe and heading back at 5AM from Praslin to Mahe .
#Text=In October 2010 the price for the passage was 125 rupees .
#Text=Schedules and routing need to be confirmed by phone .

#Text=It is also possible to take small boats from Mahe direct to La Digue , although departures can be unreliable , there is limited wet weather cover and the journey takes about 3 hours ( but that 's cheaper than an Indian Ocean Island cruise ! )
#Text=As of June 2013 , online bookings with live seat availability and e-ticketing are possible for Cat Cocos and Inter Island Ferry by Seychellesbookings.com .
#Text=By car
#Text=Driving in Seychelles is on the left side of the road .
#Text=The roads on Mahe are low-traffic , mountainous , narrow roads , so caution is generally advised .
#Text=Having a car is really a good idea and makes life much more simple .
#Text=For as little as 100 rupees worth of gas you can see the entire island of Mahe in a couple of hours , including stops at beaches and whatever else catches your eye .
#Text=There is free parking in ' downtown ' Victoria on Mahe , and if you go with a B&B or self-catering option for accommodations its by far the easiest way to pick up groceries .
#Text=A car will also allow you access to the stores where locals do their regular shopping , and the prices are more reasonable as compared to the small convenience stores along the beaches .
#Text=There is no substitute for running your vacation on your own schedule
#Text=You can only rent on Mahé and Praslin .

#Text=You can find a small car ( e. g. , Hyundai Atos ) for € 35 - 45 per day , but keep in mind that renters must be at least 21 years old , have a valid driver 's license , and have at least three years of driving experience .
#Text=There are several car hire counters outside the arrivals hall at Mahe international airport , which provide a convenient way to compare prices from different hire companies .
#Text=Prices can be negotiated , with the better rate available for rental periods of 3 consecutive days or more .
#Text=The ' excess ' payable by the customer in the event of a claim , ranges from € 300 to € 1000 depending on the company , so choose carefully and ask the right questions .
#Text=Taxis are also a popular means of transportation for both short trips and day rental and can be obtained almost anywhere .
#Text=Taxi prices for non-residents ( approx. 20 rupees per km in Sept 2010 ) on a relatively long trip , can easily exceed the cost of hiring a small car for a day .
